jobs.title: Data Integration Engineer
descriptionBullets: Managed data operations for healthcare provider network clientele
Supported healthcare provider clients with diverse technical skill levels in adopting and optimizing the use of the new pre-visit product
Created a variety of Python tools, including a Jupyter-based data monitoring dashboard and numerous Pandas data wrangling utilities
Led several automation initiatives using Airflow and Rundeck, streamlining processes
Transitioned pre-existing Informatica jobs to Airflow for enhanced efficiency
Thrived under high-pressure situations and tight deadlines, delivering detailed analyses, accurate data extractions, and managing accelerated project timelines

jobs.title: Data Integration Specialist
descriptionBullets: Cooperated with clients to seamlessly integrate vast healthcare data into Apixio's data platform
Supported key clients, accounting for over 60% of the company's revenue
Sustained Informatica pipeline for validating and processing structured and unstructured data
Executed various ad hoc operations tasks to address client needs
Utilized Python, Pandas, and Informatica for efficient data management and analysis, as well as Jupyter for visualization

jobs.title: Database Analyst
descriptionBullets: Partnered with physician researchers on outcomes-focused investigations
Engaged closely with researchers to understand data needs, delivered tailored datasets, and maintained data integrity and security in accordance with HIPAA and IRB standards
Crafted intricate SQL queries using MS SQL Server and IBM Netezza for retrieval, aggregation, and transformation of large-scale data from an on-site EDW
Skillfully extracted and managed data from EHR backends, while leveraging licensed databases like IBM MarketScan and Medi-Span to address diverse client requirements
Efficiently delivered over 100 datasets within a year, making a notable impact on medical research publications that cited the provided data

jobs.title: Graduate Research Assistant
descriptionBullets: Collaborated with Kihara Labs at Purdue on machine vision applications for protein binding prediction
Implemented and fine-tuned an advanced machine vision algorithm based on academic research
Significantly reduced runtimes from multiple weeks to 10 minutes using an innovative precomputing approach
Implemented the algorithm in both Matlab (GNU Octave) and Python for versatility
Contributed to the scientific community by publishing the open-source code in Source Code for Biology and Medicine (Springer)
